upmarket.translation[0].definitions[0].d: designed for or used by people who have a lot of money
upmarket.translation[1].definitions[0].d: involving goods and services that are expensive and perhaps of good quality compared to other goods etc of the same type, or the people that buy them
upmarket.translation[2].definitions[0].d: to start buying or selling more expensive goods or services
upmarket.translation[2].definitions[0].e: The travel operator is trying to lose its cheap image and move upmarket with more exotic destinations.
upmarket.translation[2].definitions[1].d: to change a product or a service, or people’s ideas about it, so that it is or seems to be more expensive and of better quality
upmarket.translation[2].definitions[1].e: He took the retailer upmarket, adding European designer clothing to its range.
